articles.title: The Celtics had their worst shooting night in years in loss to Jalen Brunson, Knicks: 7 takeaways
articles.description:
Boston went a brutal 17.1 percent from 3-point range.

This loss raises concerns for Boston's playoff positioning and team morale.

articles.title: Why Mike Vrabel played U2 before Patriots’ final Super Bowl meeting
articles.description:
“He left players with 3 words on today's plan: Belief, Identity, Rage."

This motivational approach aims to enhance team morale for Boston fans during the championship.

articles.title: ‘You guys got it wrong’: Rodney Harrison calls out Tony Dungy over Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
articles.description:
Dungy wouldn't say whether he voted for Belichick. Harrison told him the committee got it absolutely wrong.

The post ‘You guys got it wrong’: Rodney Harrison calls out Tony Dungy over Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Rodney Harrison criticized Tony Dungy for not supporting Bill Belichick's Hall of Fame candidacy.
Dungy did not disclose his voting stance on Belichick's nomination.
This controversy highlights ongoing debates about Belichick's legacy among Boston sports fans.

articles.title: Atlanta Falcons rookie James Pearce Jr. arrested after what police said was a domestic dispute with WNBA player
articles.description:
According to jail records, Pearce is facing charges of two counts of aggravated battery with a deadly weapon as well as aggravated stalking and fleeing or eluding police with lights or siren.

The post Atlanta Falcons rookie James Pearce Jr. arrested after what police said was a domestic dispute with WNBA player appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Atlanta Falcons rookie James Pearce Jr. arrested for domestic dispute on February 8.
Pearce faces multiple charges, including two counts of aggravated battery and stalking.
Local sports community concerned about implications for player conduct and safety.

Hudson's actions may influence public perception of Kraft among Boston sports fans.

articles.title: Cheers, gasps, and silence: How it felt on the mountain in Cortina the moment Lindsey Vonn crashed
articles.description:
“She dared greatly. She put it all out there,” her sister Karin Kildow told NBC. “It’s really hard to see, but we just really hope she’s OK.”

The post Cheers, gasps, and silence: How it felt on the mountain in Cortina the moment Lindsey Vonn crashed appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lindsey Vonn crashed during the 2026 Winter Olympics in Cortina, raising concerns for her safety.
Her sister, Karin Kildow, expressed hope for Vonn's recovery after the incident.
Boston residents following the Olympics are concerned about Vonn's impact on U.S. skiing prospects.
